intro: Ilicioides canadense, commonly known as Canadian holly, is a shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many evergreen and deciduous shrubs. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring glossy, elliptical leaves that remain green throughout the year. Its small, white flowers appear in clusters and are followed by bright red berries that persist into winter. The plant is adapted to acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade.
